p: Clearly, ECS is not the sole determinant of consistency between fingerprint detection times in observations and in a model LE. The applied forcing must also have significant impact. The cooling associated with (highly uncertain) negative indirect anthropogenic aerosol forcing is substantially greater in CESM1 than in CanESM2 ( 26). Larger negative aerosol forcing compensates for the larger GHG-induced tropospheric warming arising from the higher ECS of CESM1.
